content.raw:
Hey @jasonzliang , we just talked about this but I'll comment here for the record. We should be trying to make pull requests as small and self-contained as possible to make it easier to review and spot bugs. See [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development) gazebo tutorial for reference.

Looking at the list of files for this PR I can already spot a great self-contained pull request: add the NAO model :wink: 

Since I know you and @nima_sh have been working together on some of these changes, perhaps you both could coordinate to split the code and make a lot of small pull requests, one for each "functionality", its own tests and well documented. Some pull requests might depend on each other, so we should start with the ones which are essential and build up from there once those are merged.

Looking at the list of files for this PR I can already spot a great self-contained pull request: add the NAO model

Some pull requests might depend on each other, so we should start with the ones which are essential and build up from there once those are merged.
